reasons_to_visit.details: Fiery rituals on Calton Hill welcome summer with drummers and acrobats.
Sunset after 9pm leaves ample time for exploration.
Warmer weather invites day trips to the Kingdom of Fife and East Lothian beaches.
Farmers' markets brim with asparagus, wild garlic, and new potatoes.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Weekend accommodation and castle tickets book out for ceremonies.
Flowering gorse and pollen may bother allergy sufferers.
St Andrews tee times and golf tours must be reserved months in advance.

weather.precipitation: Mostly dry with gentle breezes; occasional North Sea haar (sea mist).
weather.general_tips: Carry sunglasses and a light jacket; haar can cool temperatures quickly.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate with influx of photographers and hikers.
tourism_level.pricing: Rates increase slightly over bank holidays.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Optimistic with outdoor dining terraces reopening.

events_holidays.name: Beltane Fire Festival
events_holidays.description: Celtic-inspired procession marking the start of summer.
events_holidays.notes: Ticketed event-arrive early for good vantage points.

events_holidays.name: May Day Traditions
events_holidays.description: Students sing at dawn on Calton Hill and roll cheese down Arthur's Seat.

unique_experiences.description: Golden gorse carpets the hillside; birdsong echoes across the city.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Start climb 45 minutes before sunrise; bring picnic breakfast.

unique_experiences.description: Explore secret courtyards blooming with spring flowers.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book with Cobble Tales; wear comfortable shoes for steep steps.

unique_experiences.description: Cruise beneath iconic bridges spotting seals and seabirds.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take train to Dalmeny; tours subject to wind conditions.

unique_experiences.description: Seasonal tasting menu highlights Scottish seafood.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Lunch offers better availability and value; request window seat over the Shore.

weather.precipitation: Light showers with increasingly warm afternoons.
weather.general_tips: Evenings remain cool-bring layers for twilight walks.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate-high as cruise ships call at Leith.
tourism_level.pricing: Hotels fill over bank holiday weekends.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Festive with outdoor ceilidhs and beer gardens buzzing.

events_holidays.name: Victoria Day Weekend
events_holidays.description: Long weekend draws Scottish families to the capital.

unique_experiences.description: Ride the promenade and cross the tidal causeway at low tide.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check tide tables and plan return before water rises.

unique_experiences.description: Extended hours with live music and cocktails among glasshouses.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Tickets required; bring layers for cool evenings.

unique_experiences.description: Visit abbeys and explore Sir Walter Scott's Abbotsford home.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Hire a car or join small coach; book guided tours ahead.

unique_experiences.description: Castle views with craft beer brewed onsite.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Reserve outdoor pods; blankets provided but nights can be brisk.
